description: New York, the largest city in the U.S., is an architectural marvel with plenty of historic monuments, magnificent buildings and countless dazzling skyscrapers. Besides the architectural delights, New York is an urban jungle that has everything to offer to visitors. The city is home to numerous museums, parks, trendy neighborhoods and shopping streets.

restaurants.title: Gusteau’s
restaurants.subtitle: french
restaurants.description: Our staff welcomes you at the venerable Building at the Europaplatz from the early mornings until late at night with healthy enjoyment from the Hiltl buffet. Freshly pressed juices, homemade iced teas & lemonades, delicious coffee & tea specialities and classic cocktails are served at the original post counter from the 1930ies. All the vegetarian and vegan delicacies can be enjoyed in-house or to-go at the train, tram, bus or in the classrooms.

restaurants.title: Flo’s V8 Cafe
restaurants.subtitle: American

hotels.title: The Beekman, a Thompson Hotel
hotels.subtitle: our pick
hotels.description: Set in the Financial District, this posh hotel is a 3-minute walk from the Fulton Street subway station and a 14-minute walk from the iconic Brooklyn Bridge.

hotels.title: New York Marriott Downtown
hotels.subtitle: Luxury
hotels.description: Modern Downtown lodging offering warm rooms & suites, plus a burger joint, a bar & a fitness room.

hotels.title: W New York - Downtown
hotels.subtitle: Kitch
hotels.description: Set among bars and restaurants in Lower Manhattan, this chic hotel is 7 minutes' walk from the One World Trade Center, a 4-minute walk from the Wall Street subway station, and 6 minutes on foot from the National September 11 Memorial & Museum.

hotels.title: Andaz Wall Street
hotels.subtitle: Kitch
hotels.description: This sleek high-rise hotel in the financial district is 2 blocks from the New York Stock Exchange, 7 blocks from South Street Seaport and 8 blocks from the World Trade Center.

description: Paris, France’s capital, is a major European city and a global center for art, fashion, gastronomy and culture. Its 19th-century cityscape is crisscrossed by wide boulevards and the River Seine. Beyond such landmarks as the Eiffel Tower and the 12th-century, Gothic Notre-Dame cathedral, the city is known for its cafe culture and designer boutiques along the Rue du Faubourg Saint-Honoré.

hotels.title: Hôtel Grandiose
hotels.subtitle: our pick
hotels.description: Inaugurated under Napoleon III, the InterContinental Paris le Grand is located in the heart of Paris, offering guests a magnificent view of the Opera Garnier.

hotels.title: Grand Paris Hôtel
hotels.subtitle: Luxury
hotels.description: Located in central Paris, this hotel is 100 metres from Gare de l’Est Train Station. It has a 24-hour front desk and offers guest rooms with satellite TV.

hotels.title: Maison Bernadette
hotels.subtitle: Kitch
hotels.description: Set in the heart of the beautiful French Pyrenees in the rural village of Artalens, we are just 10 minutes drive from Argeles-Gazost.

hotels.title: Hôtel Rousseau
hotels.subtitle: Kitch
hotels.description: Surrounded by shops and eateries, this sophisticated hotel is a 5-minute walk from both the Geneva train station and Lake Geneva, and 12 minutes on foot from St. Pierre Cathedral.

description:
Sydney is known as the Harbour City. It's the largest, oldest and most cosmopolitan city in Australia with an enviable reputation as one of the world's most beautiful and liveable cities.

Brimming with history, nature, culture, art, fashion, cuisine, design, Sydney's set next to miles of ocean coastline and sandy surf beaches. Longterm immigration has led to the cities reputation as one of the most culturally and ethnically diverse cities in Australia and the world. The city is also home to the Sydney Opera House and the Sydney Harbour Bridge, two of the most iconic structures on this planet.

hotels.title: The Westin Sydney
hotels.subtitle: our pick
hotels.description: Posh lodging in an 1891 building, offering a striking modern restaurant set in an atrium.

hotels.title: The Grace Hotel
hotels.subtitle: Luxury
hotels.description: Set in a 1920s Neo-Gothic building with an art deco interior, this traditional hotel is a 7-minute walk from Sea Life Sydney Aquarium and 2 km from Sydney Opera House.

hotels.title: Travelodge Hotel Sydney Wynyard
hotels.subtitle: Kitch
hotels.description: Close to Wynyard Station, this straightforward hotel in a high-rise building is 2 km from both Sydney Harbour Bridge and Sydney Opera House.

hotels.title: Sydney Harbour Marriott Hotel at Circular Quay
hotels.subtitle: Luxury
hotels.description: A 3-minute walk from Sydney Harbour, this polished hotel is also 1 km from Sydney Opera House and 12 km from Sydney Airport.

description: Venice is a beautiful city located in northeast Italy that is famous for its intricate transport system of interconnected canals. A perfect setting for a magical Valentines break. It has been described as the most beautiful city built by man and one of Europe’s most romantic cities. Venice is also known for its art, architecture and culture. So you’ll never be short of something to do in the “City of Bridges”.

hotels.title: Alla Vite Dorata
hotels.subtitle: our pick
hotels.description: Set along a Venetian canal, this charming inn with exposed brick walls is a 10-minute walk from the Rialto Bridge and a 14-minute walk from the Piazza San Marco public square.

hotels.title: Antico Panada
hotels.subtitle: Luxury
hotels.description: Set in the San Marco district, this warm, 19th-century Venetian hotel is a 2-minute walk from St. Mark’s Square, a 7-minute walk from La Fenice and an 8-minute walk from the Rialto Bridge.

hotels.title: WellVenice Grand Canal
hotels.subtitle: Kitch
hotels.description: Set within the San Polo district in Venice, WellVenice Grand Canal has air conditioning, a balcony, and sea views.

hotels.title: Primaluce
hotels.subtitle: Kitch
hotels.description: Located in Venice, Primaluce features a garden. Well situated in the Dorsoduro district, the property is 180 m from Basilica dei Frari and a 15-minute walk from Rialto Bridge.
